> [men312](#comment_2_1DR9EVmTR2KA8mJXmzTknbEAUzveKLRJut): My blog p2p software  http://127.0.0.1:43110/1P5Sybb44xTi6T6o5e2buZ8SR1zdsbX3Ae/

Интересные посты. Что касается цензуры, то я сожалею, что в России происходят такие же негативные события, как и на Западе. Я еще не знал OtterBrowser. FalconBrowser тоже хорош. Легкий с AdBlock. Может быть, вам стоит попробовать MLDonkey. Функция поиска реализована менее эффективно, чем Emule, и после сбоя файл блокировки должен быть удален вручную, но MLDonkey поддерживает дополнительные протоколы и может подключаться к нескольким серверам одновременно. Вполне конечно и ресурсосбережение.
https://www.falkon.org/download/
https://ru.wikipedia.org/wiki/MLDonkey

1560935624_1FqSXCYG7aTFqtAbtRi1qQ7ZEprgp.body:
Learning python is not just in my todo list but i estimate python and stumbled upon "thonny" by browsing through the "programming" category of major geeks (an oldschool software repository with carefully selected goodies to use on windows boxes,  with most of them still functioning on XP too). And the description sounds promising, particularly for beginners with python:   
https://www.majorgeeks.com/files/details/thonny.html
There is also a comprehensive python cheatsheet in txt format: https://www.majorgeeks.com/files/details/comprehensive_python_cheatsheet.html

L'apprendimento di python non è realmente nella mia lista di cose da fare, ma stimolo python e mi soffermerò inaspettato su "thonny" sfogliando la categoria "programmazione" dei major geeks (un repositorio di software oldschool con chicche accuratamente selezionate da usare su ciste windows, con la maggior parte ancora funziona anche su XP). E la descrizione sembra promettente, in particolare per i principianti con python: 
https://www.majorgeeks.com/files/details/thonny.html
C'è anche un cheatsheet python completo in formato txt:
https://www.majorgeeks.com/files/details/comprehensive_python_cheatsheet.html

1561578874_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac.body:
The 4GB version is quite interesting. It is likely  that more common desktop linux distributions will officially run on raspberry pi 4 
 but i would suggest the system should be completely loaded into RAM at boot because SD cards are not good with read/write cycles (I.E. just as in puppy linux). I am curious if Pi4 could be used as a terminal server (something like LTSP.org ) to improve performance of an old laptop which has not much more than 1GB. I definitely would prefer 2 Ethernet instead of 2 HDMI for that. In such setting it could nicely host something like a tor gateway as well. And of couse a zeronet bundle! I heard  the GPU part stil relies on proprietary stuff anyway, but that way it would not really require it.
